Metadata.Title: Use TLS to Protect Web Service Connections
Metadata.DirectLink: Use SSL/TLS to Protect Web Service Connections

Content.Data:
==What to Do==
Use TLS to protect Web Service connections.
==Why==
Protect Web Service connections using TLS to prevent man-in-the-middle attacks.
==How==
To use TLS to protect Web Service connections:
# **Get valid certificates.** Provision valid certificates for the server hosting the Web Services. # **Set up TLS on the server.** Configure the server to use TLS for the Web Services. Don't allow unencrypted connections to the Web Services â€“ don't bind Web Services to ports that don't use TLS. # **Update client code to use TLS.** Change client code to connect to the Web Services using the port that uses TLS.
